Estimates are not deadlines.

They get treated like them though.

Here's why:

Your manager or PM asks, "How long will this take?"...
The response: "It would take me 3 days"

Without realizing it, an implicit agreement was just made: "If I work on this, I'm agreeing to finishing it within 3 days."

But here's the crazy part ğŸ¤¯: Your manager or PM probably didn't even want that agreement!

They also would have been ok with:
â€¢ "It's a small"
â€¢ "Finishing it within a sprint seems reasonable"
â€¢ "I'd need to dig in more to give more certainty. Do you just need a rough guess?"

Many times, they just need a rough idea so they can prioritize.

And yes, there are cases where even when you do this, that initial ballpark number you threw out gets treated like a deadline. 

But, having tried this in practice, those rarely happen when you answer very explicitly.

If it does happen, you can now say, "At the time, I let you know it was a rough guess. If we need more certainty, I'll need to spend time scoping."

Make it clear what you are agreeing and not agreeing to.
